channel.title: RSChronical
channel.description:
This is some new Jagex Game, I have a few free beta keys if you use a key please post which key you use so others don't try to use it! You can read about it here: http://www.rschronicle.com/ E88S-YVBK-ZOE7 U28V-054S-V74L UZ85-2Y5N-MHX5 Also kudos to Jagex for taking the time to thank StackOverflow a service it seems they rely on often for opinions and advice:
ANNEX A Chronicle: RuneScape Legends was developed in Unity by Jagex Limited and makes use of various Third Party Software libraries. General thanks to: Libraries used by the Chronicle client and launcher Apache log4net - https://logging.apache.org/log4net/ Ionic.Zip - https://dotnetzip.codeplex.com/ LumenWorks.Framework.IO - http://www.codeproject.com/Articles/9258/A-Fast-CSV-Reader Newtonsoft.Json - http://www.newtonsoft.com/json Open-vcdiff - https://github.com/google/open-vcdiff Protobuf-net - https://github.com/mgravell/protobuf-net We would also like to extend our thanks to the StackOverflow community and the Unity3d community for help on far too many subjects to list here.

item.title: RSChronical
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

Chassy13:

Don’t forget that the game is only in Beta.

Which means there won’t be huge changes until release, but rather card changes and additions.

EDIT: I was wrong, there is some great counters, but it is 100% guesswork when you should play them.

Stealing gold can be very useful, same with battling rival or taking weapon durability. However, since you’ve no idea what the opponent have played, you’re just guessing if it’s useful at the moment.

Read full topic

item.title: RSChronical
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

z:

i haven’t looked at HS at all, but i’m sure they have something like that right? booster packs for sale on the market for real life cash? and how is the ranking over there?

Yes, packs are available through in-game gold earned by winning games and doing daily quests, or purchased with real money. You also get a pack from each week’s Tavern Brawl and sometimes other cases.

Getting new cards in HS is extremely slow, but you won’t get to Legend ranking in most cases if you have good cards but suck at the game… Popular streamers of HS (like Trump, Kripp, etc.) have built decks using starter cards only and have reached Legend or at least very close. Thus it’s arguable that HS is ‘pay2win’

The problem I have with Hearthstone is the absurd amount of RNG in every single deck - deal damage to two random minions, hit a random minion, summon a random minion, discard a random card, the list goes on. It can be extremely frustrating to lose to pure RNG even when you’ve clearly outplayed the opponent.

The other problem is that Blizzard is terrified to touch any cards. I know you don’t play, but if you want proof of this point, look up Dr. Boom.

Read full topic

item.title: RSChronical
item.dc:creator: @z z
item.description:
@z wrote:

i’m sure by the time they release booster packs for sale on the market, players’ ranks will be inversely proportional to the amount they’ve invested (more invested = lower rank)

i haven’t looked at HS at all, but i’m sure they have something like that right? booster packs for sale on the market for real life cash? and how is the ranking over there?

btw, I hate that we’re comparing HS to this game since they’re a bit different, from what i’ve read in previous posts…

Read full topic

item.title: RSChronical
item.dc:creator: @silabsoft RuneAgent
item.description:
@silabsoft wrote:

[quote=“z, post:24, topic:553968”][quote author=Miss Silabsoft link=topic=672890.msg4499737#msg4499737 date=1448909370]

The issue I’m encountering is that people seemed to know their decks better, or they’re getting dealt better cards. In one case, I was dealt a dragon in my first hand. There is no way I want to fight that dragon early on, because I’ll lose a lot of health. In another case, mentioned above, I died from a really good strategy that the Thief managed to pull off. So, I agree with you, that the game seems to have a strong imbalance.

you know you can click the cards and swap them in your first hand right?
[/quote]Yeah, but I still end up getting shit cards even post-exchange -_-[/quote]

its true sometimes you get delt a shitty start hand or you might get everything except that one fucking card you need to absolutely destroy the opponent but thats where deckbuilding comes in you don’t want to build for just one scenario you need to build a well rounded deck. I’ve been playing the mage and I absolutely love when I get a full hand of cards, 8 coins, a troll shaman, and 2 earth blasts. It rarely happens in that order so I try to balance it out by having a saradomin sword for end game and a lot of strike rival cards. I’ve also found that the crafting system is pretty important for things you won’t or rarely get from the booster packs. Divine Storm is a great card for dealing with warriors. The only thing I have not really been able to counter well is a thief that stacks weapons cards with rival stikes I have no spells that can simply remove the weapon and the only card that can do it I believe is a warrior specific card. It does seem cards will have an upgrade feature at some point it will be interesting to see what they add with that enhancement.

Read full topic
